Text: Okay folks, I've been using this game tracker for well over a year consistently, here are my thoughts: It's great and simple. Very convenient! However, you need this mindset for it to help you: you are NOT trying to grow your city. You are using your city to accurately reflect your expenses. If you try to just grow your city, you'll spend more, which is silly. I love seeing the breakdown of my expenses, and this gives a clean and categorized way of doing it. It is also very aesthetic!

Text: 整體用起來很不錯！！少一顆星是因為還有很多進步空間，例如：1.縮放（無法放到最大觀看整個城市面貌）2.鑽石及金幣的消耗過於龐大，經常升級一兩次，就要再存個幾天，一天含廣告頂多20顆多 3.任務的收穫太低了吧....等幾個小時，得到的只有$100？！1~2顆鑽石？建議要隨著消耗的等級提升，不然到後面我升級一次要幾十萬金幣、幾10顆鑽石，只給我100有何用 4.廣告鑽石經常處於沒有的狀態，等了半天還是告訴我沒廣告可以看......以上是一些小建議，應該很多人有跟我一樣的問題，然而我知道開發APP很辛苦，所以辛苦你們了~~~加油，希望能越做越好~~~
text: 整體用起來很不錯少一顆星是因為還有很多進步空間例如縮放無法放到最大觀看整個城市面貌鑽石及金幣的消耗過於龐大經常升級一兩次就要再存個幾天一天含廣告頂多顆多 任務的收穫太低了吧等幾個小時得到的只有顆鑽石建議要隨著消耗的等級提升不然到後面我升級一次要幾十萬金幣幾顆鑽石只給我有何用 廣告鑽石經常處於沒有的狀態等了半天還是告訴我沒廣告可以看以上是一些小建議應該很多人有跟我一樣的問題然而我知道開發app很辛苦所以辛苦你們了加油希望能越做越好

Text: I generally don't review apps, but this one is worth it. If you're looking for a better way to track your spending and budgeting, the full version is *absolutely worth it*! Every time I make a purchase I enter it into the app, it immediately tells me where I'm at in my budget for that category, and I get to build a cute little city while keeping the best track of my money I've ever had. I don't think I have a single complaint about this app. It's so customizable and convenient. I love it.

Text: Minor bug: Regular expenses on the 31st of every month don't trigger on months with only 30 days (or less, like February). Similarly, regular expenses on the 29th or 30th don't trigger in February. This is different from what monthly subscriptions (e.g., Netflix) in real life actually do. Fun method to gamify my expenses so I have actually tracked them for 3+ years. Lets me categorize my expenses (39 categories max), as well as the payment type (e.g., which credit card), which can be filtered while using the built-in search. Tracks regular expenses but only those every week or every month - I wish it could track more (like every year, every 6 months). After awhile, you need to spend real-world money or watch ads to earn diamonds to unlock some achievements (e.g., specific buildings, vehicles, VIP citizens) or themes. If you don't care about that, using the app without frills is free.
text: minor bug regular expenses on the st of every month dont trigger on months with only days or less like february similarly regular expenses on the th or th dont trigger in february this is different from what monthly subscriptions eg netflix in real life actually do fun method to gamify my expenses so i have actually tracked them for years lets me categorize my expenses categories max as well as the payment type eg which credit card which can be filtered while using the builtin search tracks regular expenses but only those every week or every month i wish it could track more like every year every months after awhile you need to spend realworld money or watch ads to earn diamonds to unlock some achievements eg specific buildings vehicles vip citizens or themes if you dont care about that using the app without frills is free

Text: I used Fortune City for about one year before quitting last month. The UI and visualisation of expenses are good, and I like the idea of building your own city, but the app has become too slow to use as a expense tracker. Having to wait 45 seconds for the app to load every time I want to record and expense is an absolute turnoff (Huawei Y7 Prime) . My suggestion: focus less on new city themes and improve app performance instead. I'll be back when the app is smoother.

Text: The app is very good! However, the unique features of the app (city-building) encourages the users either to log religiously or to spend more to make more logs. I'd like to suggest to enable entries with negative amounts (e.g. interest movements of investment accounts). The workaround at the moment is to create two categories, one for income (for positive interest) and another one under expense accounts (for losses due to interest movement).

Text: it's an easy way to track your daily expenses. and there are a couple of helpful reports to see which categories you spend the most. Cute UI. I like that it's turn into a game so you're encouraged to come back everyday and record your transactions. What I don't like is, you'd have to actually spend on things that aren't that important. Like buying more diamonds to upgrade stuff. It also does not have the ability to transfer money from one account to another (at least in the free version). you'd have to manually track it and it's inefficient. overall, i liked it, but it's not as useful as Wallet.
text: its an easy way to track your daily expenses and there are a couple of helpful reports to see which categories you spend the most cute ui i like that its turn into a game so youre encouraged to come back everyday and record your transactions what i dont like is youd have to actually spend on things that arent that important like buying more diamonds to upgrade stuff it also does not have the ability to transfer money from one account to another at least in the free version youd have to manually track it and its inefficient overall i liked it but its not as useful as wallet

Text: This app is great, I love the cute icons and colourful interface! But overtime some features (or lack of features) reduces my rating. The recurring transactions are not automatically added in. If you forgot to enter the app that day, the option to add that transction will disappear (and you have to key the whole transaction in again which beats the point of auto). It's great that the app gives 5 free parks everytime you enter (if you don't hit the max daily building), but we can only delete it one by one and there's no option to remove this free park feature. This overall starts to slow down the app startup when there's too much buildings A good feature to add in is to total the income and expenses up-till-date. It's a hassle to still have to go thru monthly and add up my savings to figure out my total savings. It's gonna be a problem when there's many many months Overall I like this app but if these features are not improved I'll have to find a better expense tracker app

Text: Fortune City is a great way to take the boring out if budgeting. The window for a button to register a tap is extremely small and there isn't much functionality for zooming out. It's getting five stars but there's a lot of room for improvement. For starters, the app introduction is incomplete. When I first used the app, I had no idea if the bar graphs in each character page was how much that person liked that field, or the ratio of different fields that the city needs to have before the visitor wants to be a citizen. I still have no idea what the benefit of having VIP Citizens or more taxis is. If there could be a more in depth tutorial, that would be great! The amount of citizens allowed in the city should be MUCH more to accommodate the amount of growth of the city. Also, on a regular basis the game needs to show how many more buildings I need before my population count will go up. Maybe tapping the citizen count will bring up an interface that shows how many more buildings are needed. Moreover, the initial amount of builders available is too little for the amount of transactions I input in a day. Can there please be more space for adding citizens and more initial builders? I love how slowly but surely you can build gem count. It's Chibi style is so pleasing to look at and I'm glad it's a game that's useful in my everyday life. Hopefully, you all will be very successful with your ideas. Thank you for making this app, I greatly appreciate it! Strongly Recommend.
text: fortune city is a great way to take the boring out if budgeting the window for a button to register a tap is extremely small and there isnt much functionality for zooming out its getting five stars but theres a lot of room for improvement for starters the app introduction is incomplete when i first used the app i had no idea if the bar graphs in each character page was how much that person liked that field or the ratio of different fields that the city needs to have before the visitor wants to be a citizen i still have no idea what the benefit of having vip citizens or more taxis is if there could be a more in depth tutorial that would be great the amount of citizens allowed in the city should be much more to accommodate the amount of growth of the city also on a regular basis the game needs to show how many more buildings i need before my population count will go up maybe tapping the citizen count will bring up an interface that shows how many more buildings are needed moreover the initial amount of builders available is too little for the amount of transactions i input in a day can there please be more space for adding citizens and more initial builders i love how slowly but surely you can build gem count its chibi style is so pleasing to look at and im glad its a game thats useful in my everyday life hopefully you all will be very successful with your ideas thank you for making this app i greatly appreciate it strongly recommend

have things that generate even when you don't spend one day to curtail that 
urge.

Text:
Well designed fun app. I found the customizability for creating categories 
was lacking. Also, it rewards you for entering your expenditures each time 
you buy stuff. So the more shopping you do, the more successful your 
city... it seems counterintuitive to reward people for spending more money 
for an app designed to help you save. plus, the free version doesn't have 
budget goals. So the app isn't super helpful with saving unless you spend 
money to buy the full app. I also found it ironic that this money saving 
app charges $2 for purely aesthetic themes... not a good way to save money.

Text:
This is a nice app for financial self-accountability. There's no linking to 
accounts. The plus of that is more mindful entries and no privacy worries. 
It is less automated than non-gamified accounting apps, but I think that's 
part of the draw of the mindfulness part (for me at least). I only wish the 
social aspect was more involved! You can have friends in the app, but you 
only see each other's cities. There doesn't appear to be any way to help 
your friends or otherwise communicate within the app. A community, kind of 
like the labs in Walkr (another Fourdesire app) would be nice. Disclaimer - 
I paid early on not to see ads except for those to earn daily diamonds. I 
forget how common they were offhand without that.
text: this is a nice app for financial selfaccountability theres no linking to accounts the plus of that is more mindful entries and no privacy worries it is less automated than nongamified accounting apps but i think thats part of the draw of the mindfulness part for me at least i only wish the social aspect was more involved you can have friends in the app but you only see each others cities there doesnt appear to be any way to help your friends or otherwise communicate within the app a community kind of like the labs in walkr another fourdesire app would be nice disclaimer i paid early on not to see ads except for those to earn daily diamonds i forget how common they were offhand without that

Text:
I find it does encourage me to track consistently-- how else will I get new 
buildings and citizens? I do wish there was a way to keep track of what 
money is where. For instance, being able to keep track of a debt as well as 
the money you have. The other thing I'd really like to see is the ability 
to select timezones. A record only creates a new building if it was a 
record from THAT day, which encourages consistency. However, if you work 
overnights or sleep inconsistently, tracking before bed could mean after 
midnight-- so either you choose date accuracy or getting the buildings you 
deserve for tracking every day (just variably before or after midnight.)
text: i find it does encourage me to track consistently how else will i get new buildings and citizens i do wish there was a way to keep track of what money is where for instance being able to keep track of a debt as well as the money you have the other thing id really like to see is the ability to select timezones a record only creates a new building if it was a record from that day which encourages consistency however if you work overnights or sleep inconsistently tracking before bed could mean after midnight so either you choose date accuracy or getting the buildings you deserve for tracking every day just variably before or after midnight

I want to like this app. The tutorial doesn't clarify that you can edit 
categories and accounts. There is no place to put your starting balance so 
that it's not counted as an income or expense, throwing off the data. That 
said, it is very cute, and there are more aspects to the game than logging 
expenses. However, the issue of no starting balance ended up wasting a lot 
of my time, which is the last thing I want from a finance app. The point is 
to make it easier, not more difficult.

Text:
Another lovely little helper app from fourdesire. Beautiful art, ethical ad 
implementation (very short ads, very optional) & an easy city builder that 
still has progress on days when you have no expenses. Loses a star 
currently because the app sometimes throws up a "pirated" warning after 
random phone/log out crashes that forces a reinstall. An "it's safe" option 
would be handy! Gender doesn't always match names/viduals of characters, 
but that doesn't bother me :)

Text:
A great app with lots of nice features for tracking, however I think it 
needs a feel quality of life improvements: 1. Easier conversion and 
tracking for multiple currencies for international people 2. Ability to log 
a nil expense for those who have logged in but didn't spend anything - this 
encourages constant logging but not for us to spend everyday 3. Customer 
categories for when we have large miscellaneous expenses like groceries 
Otherwise great app and thanks for all the work!
text: a great app with lots of nice features for tracking however i think it needs a feel quality of life improvements easier conversion and tracking for multiple currencies for international people ability to log a nil expense for those who have logged in but didnt spend anything this encourages constant logging but not for us to spend everyday customer categories for when we have large miscellaneous expenses like groceries otherwise great app and thanks for all the work

I'm happy with everything else about the app though! Great visualizations and awesome game design overall.

Text: This is an absolutely fantastic app.  The characters are absolutely adorable, and the cat is to die for. The graphics of this app is absolutely excellent, and everything looks beautiful. The entry system is really well planned and thought out, and I love the way the stats and graphs are organised, and the entries look great.  A few concerns though. People might start faking entries and deleting them to gain the buildings they want. If I can think of this in a few days after installing the app, surely so can others. I suggest deleting the relevant building when the entry gets deleted too.  Another concern is that the entries are organised by the time they were written. I sometimes forget to write the entries at the correct time, so the order of my entries gets messed up. I think it would be fantastic if you could add in an edit timestamp and order option, since that would improve the organisation. Also, many other people have suggested a savings option, which would be really useful.  And it really makes me want to spend as much as I can!  Much thanks to the developers for creating such a beautifully designed and useful app.
text: this is an absolutely fantastic app the characters are absolutely adorable and the cat is to die for the graphics of this app is absolutely excellent and everything looks beautiful the entry system is really well planned and thought out and i love the way the stats and graphs are organised and the entries look great a few concerns though people might start faking entries and deleting them to gain the buildings they want if i can think of this in a few days after installing the app surely so can others i suggest deleting the relevant building when the entry gets deleted too another concern is that the entries are organised by the time they were written i sometimes forget to write the entries at the correct time so the order of my entries gets messed up i think it would be fantastic if you could add in an edit timestamp and order option since that would improve the organisation also many other people have suggested a savings option which would be really useful and it really makes me want to spend as much as i can much thanks to the developers for creating such a beautifully designed and useful app

Text: While I enjoy the concept of building a city and getting it to prosper the fact that I can only do so by recording daily spending doesn't help me to budget. I can go days without spending but this app makes me want to make purchases daily to grow my city.   More focus needs to be placed on saving money. A reward system for saving money. Perhaps something like if you record saving X amount you get to use a virtual equivalent of that to pay for buildings/cars etc in your city to build it up. As well as setting a budget for yourself weekly + monthly and city rewards for sticking to that budget. Ex. "How much do you wish to spend monthly for fun? How much do you need for necessities (rent, food, bills)? How much do you wish to save?"   At this point I am still deciding if I will keep using this app. I enjoy the UI/look of tracking and comparing my expenses but the game part makes it tempting to keep buying to add to my city.

Text: Amazing app. Reminds me of 2048, tiny towers, animal crossing, all the while helping you visually see where your money is going.  It's my favorite app on the app store currently and I HIGHLY recommend downloading it. It's really polished and has made me a lot more conscious about my spending, but in a healthy way that doesn't make me feel bad. Recording expenses as a habit doesn't feel like a chore, but rather, a fun daily thing you get to do to help grow a town.  I also love Cashy!! Great job to the designer/animator. I really feel much better and happier when I click on him and I wish he had more phrases. He's so cute.  Phenomenal app, Four Desire. I liked Walkr back a few years ago but it grew tedious over time. Fortune City really shines as a fun and addicting game that promote healthy expense-recording behavior, which I've always admired about this company. I love being able to see where my money goes visually.   One critique though: for the achievements, there's one section devoted to daily recording of expenses or income. While I log on everyday, I don't always spend money everyday. Maybe if there were an option to say "No expenses for today" so that I don't lose my streak?
text: amazing app reminds me of tiny towers animal crossing all the while helping you visually see where your money is going its my favorite app on the app store currently and i highly recommend downloading it its really polished and has made me a lot more conscious about my spending but in a healthy way that doesnt make me feel bad recording expenses as a habit doesnt feel like a chore but rather a fun daily thing you get to do to help grow a town i also love cashy great job to the designeranimator i really feel much better and happier when i click on him and i wish he had more phrases hes so cute phenomenal app four desire i liked walkr back a few years ago but it grew tedious over time fortune city really shines as a fun and addicting game that promote healthy expenserecording behavior which ive always admired about this company i love being able to see where my money goes visually one critique though for the achievements theres one section devoted to daily recording of expenses or income while i log on everyday i dont always spend money everyday maybe if there were an option to say no expenses for today so that i dont lose my streak

Text: Interesting way to track your expenses. I say interesting, cute even, but not exactly fun. Mainly because I have a few issues with it. This app creates a building each time you track a real world expense based on the type of expense it is. So, if I go eat out a lot, but the end of the month I should have a pretty high level restaurant. The problem is, this app tends to make me WANT to spend money in order to build out my town more. Shouldn't I get rewarded for the amount I'm saving rather than how much I'm spending? Seems a little counterintuitive. Since I'm trying to not spend any money, I usually spend the day staring at the same ol' buildings with the little townspeople occasionally asking me to find their car keys for them or some other "find this" request.  Seriously though, I like the intention of this app.   Edit: Raised to 4 stars because I found how to add recurring payment reminders so that it automatically places it on your payments for the day you assigned it to and allowed you to check it off when it'd been paid. That will be useful for me and makes this app a little more usable. However for it to be really usable, I'll probably have to modify the dates a little because I want it to tell me in advance what I'm looking at fiscally for the month... If that makes sense. Also, it doesn't sync to my account stand allow me to pay from the app which is an inconvenience that's not really worth using the app for.

Text: It's cute and easy to use, and that's enough to motivate me to record my spendings regularly. Something I'd like to commend in particular is how easy it is to earn in-game currency. There's both automatically generated currency (coins) for every function, and premium currency (diamonds) for town themes and other special features. The app gives you like 2-3 chances to earn diamonds every day, and that makes it even more motivating to go back to the app frequently. It would be nice though if I could completely opt out of the daily notifications, and if there was a feature that would show me my current total balance, not just a summary of my spendings. This app is cute and it's good for tracking cash outflow and showing your spending habits, but it's not for serious budgeting.

Text: This app is helpful for tracking your purchases, which is great.  I've seen a lot of people complain that you can't build more buildings in a single day, but... That's kind of the point? Like, you shouldn't be trying to make a city that has five new buildings everyday, because then you're making at least 5 unique purchases. Which isn't how you live on a budget. I do wish there were better categories for things. There's no "groceries" option. Which is strange since it seems like I go to the grocery store nearly everyday. And I hardly ever buy purses or hats.And there's no category for Bills. Like, I have a credit card and it's in the same category as my groceries?  This is a nice app, but it seems to focus a lot on luxury items and not so much on daily necessities.

Text: I'm loving it so far! The graphics and sounds are cute and it's fun and interactive. But there's still improvements to be made, it would be helpful to have a budget feature that allows you to set an amount and tracks how much you spend for certain categories of items over a period of time, for example, a day, week, month etc. It would also be helpful to allow users to be able to set what type of format they'd like their analytics to be, for example, they may want to view it on a weekly format rather than monthly. It would also be helpful if you could see your total income or loss balance to see the overall amount of money left or spent rather than just show the sum of incomes and losses for the month. The graphs are really useful aids though and the interface was designed really well.
text: im loving it so far the graphics and sounds are cute and its fun and interactive but theres still improvements to be made it would be helpful to have a budget feature that allows you to set an amount and tracks how much you spend for certain categories of items over a period of time for example a day week month etc it would also be helpful to allow users to be able to set what type of format theyd like their analytics to be for example they may want to view it on a weekly format rather than monthly it would also be helpful if you could see your total income or loss balance to see the overall amount of money left or spent rather than just show the sum of incomes and losses for the month the graphs are really useful aids though and the interface was designed really well

Text: Super cute..! I love managing my little city and watching it grow. The fact that only expenses recorded that same day get you more buildings gives me incentive to make sure I update my expenses as soon as I buy anything or get any income. I also LOVE that you can change the type of currency you spent. I go to Canada a lot and not having to worry about converting CAD to USD makes this app very convenient. The citizens/visitors are also adorable and have their own little things to say, as well as their own talents,  I love being able to assign them to the specific job they'd be the best at and/or the happiest with. Overall, I am very happy with this app and highly recommend it..~ I just wish I had friends to compare cities with  </3

Text: This is a budgeting app set up like a sum game. It's made to track daily expenses along with income in a very creative and fun way. There are achievements, but they aren't meant to rush you to spend - more so to pat you on the back for sticking with your recordings and making progress. It's cute, the characters are funny & it really does help you get into the habit of looking at where your money goes. I HIGHLY recommend it for young people trying to figure out money management.

Text: It's a neat and original idea, but this is a bare bones city builder game with a TERRIBLE and even more bare bones finance app. If you want to play a city builder there are far better options. Unless you are a kid this app will in no way help you with any of your finances. Tracking your use of your money can be very useful, but if your only doing it to get virtual buildings and you don't understand what to do with the info it won't help you. I use Expense IQ and its easy to input data but it also allows for customization (ie categories) so I can make things specific to how I use my money and it has far better statistics to help me understand it all. Please make a full fledged finance app for adults (the function) with a city that grows automatically as I input data and reach financial goals (saving, staying within budget) that acts as a cool aesthetic. App looks great but all of its functions are done much better by other apps and the way the app combines those functions is pointless, not fun, and not helpful to my life. I can't justify the time spent using my regular finance app which is very useful and then the time entering a lot of the same data in this app just to build a city. Untill you make this a real finance app the rest seems pointless. However this app seems FANTASTIC for kids as their finances are very basic like the app.
